bibl.author: Williamson
bibl.title: Williamson to Walt Whitman, 8 Nov 1868
bibl.orgName: Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: It has been along time since I have heard from you so I thought that I would write you aline and let you know that I am well and enjoying good health and I hope that you may receive the same Blessing I have writenwritten to you three before but have received no answer. Now Walt I have not forgotenforgotten you. I look at the picture I fancy that it looks just like you every time I look at if I wish you are here that I might shake hands with you I &c
if you get this I think you will write to me

Well Walt I must tell you the news nothinenothing so very new. Walt on the 19th day of augAugust last I took A pardner for life. She proves very kind to me so far and I trust that She will tide out. Walt I dont say much about Edition so adontI don't think of much to write as this makes the third that I write to your one. & so good luck to you if we never see each others face again but trust to providence. I will draw to a close so good bybye.

postscript.p: Address Williamson Wayne Co N. Y. Walt Whitman Washington D.C.
